item.title: Remnant 2: How To Get Pethyr Armor Set
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Find The Logistics Bridge Dungeon In Remnant 2
  • Logistics Bridge Dungeon Walkthrough In Remnant 2
  • Where To Find The Pethyr Armor Set In Logistics Bridge

Remnant 2's The Dark Horizon DLC brought lots of equipment, including a new Heavy Armor set called Pethyr Armor . However, since Remnant 2 has some procedural generation features, finding the correct spot to look for this armor can be a little tricky.

So here's what players need to do to get one of the best armor sets in the game that offers incredible resistance and damage mitigation.

How To Find The Logistics Bridge Dungeon In Remnant 2

If players already familiarized themselves with the N'erud Agronomy Sector and Withered Necropolis maps. They'll also notice there's a lot of Gliding, since that's the new transversal mechanic included in the DLC. Players looking for the Pethyr Armor set need to enter the Logistics Bridge dungeon , which is located in the Withered Necropolis area.

From the Withered Necropolis Area, where players meet the Gardener for the second time , players should grab a Glider and roam the lower levels . In our run, the Dungeon we were looking for was right below the first bridge in the Withered Necropolis, but players might have to spend some time looking for it.

For players who cannot locate the dungeons they're looking for, there's no choice but to re-start the DLC run, since these are One-Shot adventures that need to be fully reset to look for specific drops, events, and dungeons. But, try to explore every part of the Withered Necropolis before resetting it, since there might be a hidden dungeon door somewhere tucked in a corner of the map, and that might be the one players are looking for.

Logistics Bridge Dungeon Walkthrough In Remnant 2

To get to the Pethyr armor set, players will need to clear the Logistics Bridge Dungeon.

  • Players need to reach the half section of the map where they will face a jumping puzzle divided into three sections .
  • To reach the jumping puzzle, they will need to clear out a mini-boss called Void Amalgamate , grab a key item, and open a door.
  • Once players reach the train rail section : they should take note of the first section, as they will be returning there once they finish the dungeon.
  • Cross the first two rails by jumping after the wagons pass by. If players aren't careful, they'll be hit by the trains and die . Wait for a train to pass, then jump.
  • After the first two rails, they'll reach a circular section with lots of enemies that need to be cleared out. Kill them and jump between the platforms until reaching the middle section with a staircase leading to an observation room .
  • Enter the observation room, kill the Minion standing guard, and activate the platform lever (this will also clear one of the locks that needs to be activated before reaching the Pethyr armor).
  • Next, players should leave the observation post and turn in the direction where the jumping puzzle started. Track back using the same system, but through the platforms below. Keep a close look for the train patterns before jumping and reaching the next and last part of the dungeon.
  • Players will notice a new control room they can reach by accessing an elevator . At the top, there's a door that will automatically open, unlocking the second part needed to access the armor. Don't forget to grab the Burden of the Excavator before proceeding.

Video Walkthrough Of Remnant 2's Logistics Bridge Dungeon

Where To Find The Pethyr Armor Set In Logistics Bridge

Once players get the Quest Clear prompt and return to the starting part of the Jumping Puzzle section, right to the checkpoint, they will need to cross again into the first subsection between the two rails.

Once there, stick to the right and look for a chest . Near that chest, players will notice there are breakable objects. Smash them and proceed to climb the boxes , then jump onto a small platform with a second chest . This subsection was obstructed by the first activation switch, and now players can climb another platform to keep going.

There's one more small section with a platform they need to jump onto, and one of the platforms with crates is now available for reach. Don't get confused and try not to jump down; it is all a straightforward path until reaching the Pethyr Armor that is hanging in an open locker .

Pethyr Armor Set Stats In Remnant 2

Chest

Boots

Gloves

Helmet

Armor

80.6

43.8

17.4

19.8

Weight

39.9

21.7

8.6

9.8

Bleed Res

4

2

2

3

Fire Res

6

2

2

3

Shock Res

6

3

1

3

Blight Res

7

4

2

4

Toxin Res

3

2

1

5

As players might have noticed, The Pethyr Armor is a Heavy Armor set with some serious resistance, and in some cases, even better than the Leto Mark II set. Its heaviness might not be such a problem if players use it alongside certain accessories that reduce overall weight or increase the weight burden threshold.

item.title: 47 Best Amazon Post-Prime Day 2024 Deals on Video Game Deals
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Video Game Deals
  • Best PS5 Game Deals
  • Best Xbox Series X/S Game Deals
  • Best Nintendo Switch Game Deals
  • Should You Purchase A Video Game On Prime Days?

It’s that time of year again! October is when Amazon’s biggest Prime Day deals are up for grabs, and players can look forward to a wide variety of gaming essentials, from high-end headsets to AAA games. Even before the actual Prime Day sale, which is slated for October 7th-10th, there are dozens of great games available at a discount. Some of these deals are exclusive to Prime members, but don't fret! New members can try Prime for 30 days, free.

Although there weren’t as many big hits as in 2023, the fact that we’re a year on from a seriously great year in gaming means the chance of seeing a big game with an even bigger discount is pretty high. These are the best video game deals currently available, but Game Rant will continue to update this list as the sale approaches and, inevitably, more games get discounted.

Best Video Game Deals

Some of the best games of 2023 and 2024 are on sale for Prime Day, even ahead of the big sale on October 8th-9th. Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance was just released this past June, yet for a limited time, players can grab this new game for 33% off list price! Similarly, gamers can save 30% on Final Fantasy VII Rebirth , which was released in February of this year.

Both of these games offer dozens of hours of playtime, plus each has an impressive legacy that always leaves fans itching for more. Plus, the version of Final Fantasy VII Rebirth that’s on sale is the exclusive Amazon edition, which comes with a bonus controller skin for free! Meanwhile, Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance represents a rare 28% discount on a Switch title, despite its recent release.

Gamers who prefer titles they can play on their choice of console are in luck too. Unicorn Overlord , a sprawling RPG with hours of tactical gameplay and dozens of characters to choose from, is on sale for every platform, cutting the price down by a third regardless of the version. One of the best deals is the 2024 Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth game, which is available with big discounts for both PS5 and Xbox Series X players. This game promises a GTA -style criminal plot, paired with Dead Rising -esque humor throughout. There are no plans to release the game on Game Pass, making it even better that the Xbox version of Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth is half-off.

Best PS5 Game Deals

Prime Day is the perfect opportunity for PlayStation gamers to snag some of the best PS5 games at unbeatable prices. With amazing deals on top titles, this is the ideal time to expand game collections and experience some of the most acclaimed games available. This year, we have excellent offers for God of War: Ragnarök and The Last of Us Part I, both of which are must-haves for any PS5 owner and have about 34% off each.

But those aren’t the only Sony-exclusive titles on sale. Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales is another top pick, offering a thrilling superhero adventure for just $31. There’s also Uncharted: Legacy of Thieves Collection, which brings together epic adventures with enhanced graphics. At just $33, it offers not one but two games, completely remastered for the PS5.

For action-packed adventures, gamers can snag Elden Ring with a $20 saving, while Harry Potter fans can fulfill their Hogwarts dreams with a cool $36 discount on Hogwarts Legacy. And for a nostalgic throwback, Ubisoft’s Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown is available for a budget-friendly $30 price tag.

If tactical battles are one's jam, then Marvel's Midnight Suns Enhanced Edition is a steal at $50 off, bringing the cost down to just $20. On the other hand, fans of racing can also pick up either Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged or LEGO 2K Drive, both of which are available for just $30 and $20 respectively. Diablo 4 is also on offer, currently on sale for just $37.

Soccer fans can get a copy of EA SPORTS FC 24 available for just $40. And for those who prefer fighting as a sport, there's Street Fighter 6 available for just $37, down from $60. And for fans of Yakuza, there's a 50% discount on Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth during the Prime Day sale. The sale also has the Steelbook Launch Edition of Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance on offer for just $40.

Best Xbox Series X/S Game Deals

As for Microsoft’s console, most gamers are already subscribed to the Xbox Game Pass, which gives them access to a massive library of games. However, there are plenty of Xbox games for both the Series X and S for non-subscribers to snag. For instance, Prime Day throws a knockout punch with an almost 40% discount on Tekken 8. Keep in mind that this is a game that launched just this year, making it a solid deal for any fans of the fighting genre. And for just $18, the Standard Edition of Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy can be bought during the Prime Day sale. That's a great discount for an AAA game that was launched for $60 a couple of years ago.

Starfield, at nearly half the price, is Bethesda’s epic space RPG that transports players to a vast and immersive universe. Alternatively, there’s Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, which offers a completely different universe of Pandora for players to explore. At 23% off of its original price tag, the game offers an immersive open-world experience that most gamers would enjoy. Prime Day also sees Assassin's Creed Mirage drop down to just $40, which is the latest game in the franchise's history. Keep in mind this is the Launch Edition we're talking about, which includes added bonuses.

As for racing fans, both LEGO 2K Drive and Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged have discounts during the Amazon Prime Day sale, making them a great choice for gamers wanting to try something different than the Forza lineup on their Xbox.

At almost a 40% discount is Diablo 4, which is a must-play for RPG fans. One can battle hordes of demons, uncover dark secrets, and build powerful characters in a game that will only cost them half the price thanks to Prime Day. On the other hand, for players craving bone-chilling thrills, the terrifying remake of Dead Space is available for a frighteningly good price of just $42. And for fans of wrestling, WWE 2K24 is available for just $46.

Speaking of fighting games, Street Fighter 6 is on offer for $37, while Mortal Kombat 1 is available for $46. There's also 50% off on Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth. Additionally, Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition is also on sale for $58.

Best Nintendo Switch Game Deals

Nintendo almost never offers discounts on their games, even when partnered with a retailer as powerful as Amazon. Despite this, they always throw players a few bones during October Prime Days, and we’re already seeing a handful of examples.

Super Mario Bros. Wonder was released less than a year ago, but Nintendo fans can pick it up for 13% less than normal during early Prime Day deals. For the same price, you can pick up Pikmin 4 too, which also came out in 2023 and is highly rated. Those discounts may seem small, but for mainline Nintendo games released last year, it’s more than enough.

For players looking to grab a stocking stuffer or otherwise get a lot of game for a little bit of money can take advantage of the discounted Disney Classic Games Collection , which is on sale for less than $25 right now. This collection of movie tie-in games includes The Lion King , The Jungle Book , and the infamous Aladdin .

Should You Purchase A Video Game On Prime Days?

So far, most gamers should probably not be buying a new video game until Prime Day actually starts. If one of these games is specifically one that you’ve been waiting for, definitely grab it quickly, as there is almost a guarantee that these deals will soon be replaced with more lucrative discounts on other AAA titles.

Game Rant will continue to update these deals as they are replaced with bigger and better things. Stay tuned, and keep checking back to make the most of Prime Day 2024!

item.title: The 8 Best Rockstar Games Not Available On PC
item.description: Rockstar Games is one of the most prolific and well-known developers in the video game space, mostly due to their creation of the Grand Theft Auto series. Yet, despite their success, and the occasional port of their games over to PC after it's been on consoles for a while, Rockstar Games still has yet to bring over official ports and remasters for some truly iconic games.

item.title: 18 RTS Games That Are Perfect For Newcomers To The Genre
item.description:
The launch of RTS giants like Age of Empires 4 brought a wave of excitement for fans of the genre. And the best games to get the first Real-time Strategy experience are numerous. RTS games (or real-time strategy Games) are a very fast-paced version of their progenitors, strategy games. RTS games force the players to adjust and respond in a real-time scenario, unlike normal strategy games. This makes each game very fast-paced and dynamic.

With the genre producing a few mainstream releases, newcomers might be interested in taking the plunge, but the difficulty of learning in a competitive culture can deter many. Thankfully, there are plenty of RTS games for beginners to jump into.

Updated on October 1, 2024, by Mehrdad Khayyat: The ability to lead a group of soldiers or people toward victory gives anyone a joyful sense of power, and Real-Time Strategy games are pretty good at implying that feeling to their players. Making the right decision at critical moments when the player doesn't have much time to think is one of the major challenges in any RTS game.

Based on the complexity of the game, there are multiple factors to consider when playing an RTS game, which could be quite overwhelming, especially for newcomers to the genre. However, there are indeed some classic RTS experiences where the developers keep mechanics simple and let the players enjoy the flow without putting a lot of pressure on them.

18 Rise Of Nations

Feel The Sense Of Progression Through Ages

Rise of Nations is one of the greatest RTS games that unfortunately never received a sequel or a remake. The game allows players to choose from a span of 18 nations at the beginning of the game, then start progressing from the ancient ages to the modern times.

Players start an empire barebones with all the ancient tools, but as time passes, they expand their knowledge and invest in science, allowing them to enter new ages and feel the true sense of progression. From the Ancient Age to the Copper Age, and from the Copper Age to the Internet Age, players start to build an army with blades and swords, but in the end, they unlock missiles and ships when enough time has passed.

While progressing through the ages might seem a bit complicated, the gameplay mechanics in Rise of Nations are quite simple, which makes it a fascinating game for RTS rookies.

17 Wargame Series

A Great Starting Point For Combat-Focused RTS

For those who value combat in RTS games more than anything else, Wargame titles could bring a lot of joy. While the Total War series nails it in simulating gigantic wars with old weaponry like swords and arrows, Wargame almost does the same with modern wars where tanks, missiles, and long-range guns dictate the fate of the battles.

While Wargame might seem a little bit complicated in the beginning, it is a good starting point for players who want an all-out warfare simulation without the need to care about people's happiness or any similar side factors. The depth of combat in Wargame titles is magnificent and it will reward players who pay attention to the details.

16 Age Of Empires Series

A Legendary RTS Series That's Always Been Beginner-Friendly

Age of Empires is a classic franchise in the RTS genre and fans of the series were elated to hear news of a fourth entry. Some people feel like it emulates Age of Empires 2 a bit too much for their liking, but this was a small gripe for what was otherwise a brilliant title in every way.

Age of Empires is one of the rare franchises in gaming that delivers top-notch experiences with every single iteration. The game always depicts medieval-era battles with quire simplistic mechanics and controls that feels easy to learn for every newcomer, as there are not too many factors to deal with.

15 Empire Earth

Familiar Age Of Empires Gameplay On Steroids

The gameplay loop of Age of Empires is pretty by-the-numbers and easy to understand. Empire Earth emulates this for the most part, making it easy to see why beginners will find it quite easy to jump into this legendary RTS.

What helps this title stand out is the sheer number of ages players can progress through in the game. People start in the prehistoric age before moving on to medieval times, but that's not it. Players can progress to modern times before progressing to the future too.

14 The Pikmin Series

A Cozy Strategy Game That's Designed To Be Approachable

Despite labeling itself as an RTS, Pikmin doesn't feature a gameplay loop that most people would expect from this genre. Still, despite its unique presentation, it's one of the easier strategy games to get into.

The release of Pikmin 4 was a source of great celebration for fans of the series. The combination of platforming, puzzle-solving, and strategy makes for a great time as players gather more of these adorable critters to do their bidding across a series of levels.

13 The Lord Of The Rings: The Battle For Middle-earth 2

The Combination Of A Popular IP And Simple Yet Engaging Gameplay Makes This An Easy Recommendation

The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth 2 is a particularly great choice for RTS newcomers if they're already fans of the Lord of the Rings franchise, as the familiarity that they'll have with units, maps, and movesets will come in handy.

However, Battle for Middle-Earth is also a good pick for those not previously interested in Tolkien's universe, as the game is accommodating to beginners with tutorials that impressively manage to be detailed without being overwhelming for those who have never even tried a real-time strategy game before.

12 Sins Of A Solar Empire

A Few Playthroughs Are All It Takes To Understand How To Rule The Galaxy

Sins of a Solar Empire is one of the best-named sci-fi games of the last decade, and despite its hard-sounding title, it's actually one of the best RTS for beginner s . Its gameplay is straightforward and reminiscent of Civilization . It's well-balanced and built with easy-to-grasp progression systems, though it might take some getting used to all the technobabble.

It's an older game, too, having been released nearly a decade and a half ago in 2008, and it is likely to run perfectly on just about any modern system.

11 Northgard

A Viking-Focused RTS That's Easy To Learn But Hard To Master

Northgard is a beginner-friendly but hard-to-master recent entry in the RTS genre. It puts the player in control of a clan of Vikings looking to secure their dominance in a newfound world. The colorful (and almost cartoony) graphics make it stand out amongst similar fantasy strategy games.

Most RTS games have a basic campaign mode, like in Starcraft 2 and Halo Wars , and Northgard is no exception. However, there's a lot more to the game than the narrative, and it's as replayable as it is a feast for the eyes.

10 Stellaris

An Excellent Grand Strategy Game Set In Space That's Not That Hard To Get Into

Stellaris is an incredibly deep sci-fi RTS that centers around building a galactic empire from the very beginning. Like many RTS games , Stellaris features a progression system that changes over time, offering players new technologies, powers, and attributes as they continue to expand.

As complex as the game is, it features great tutorials and a variety of difficulties to get to know how the mechanics of Stellaris work. It's by no means a difficult game to grasp, but there are a lot of things going on that can take a little while to properly learn.

9 Total War: Warhammer Series

The Combination Of Total War's Gameplay Loop With The Warhammer Franchise Makes For A Delectable Combination

The Warhammer franchise is one of the biggest expanded game verses that spans many genres and forms of media. Thus, it is only fair for newer players to be wary of this title. But players can rest assured that Creative Assembly and Sega's brainchild, Total War: Warhammer 2, is one of the easiest titles for the first RTS experience.

Not to forget the easy entry it gives players into the extensive Warhammer fandom. This series is perfect for all RTS beginners, especially Warhammer fans. The third installment, however, adds a bit more complexity to the gameplay by introducing hero-style leaders that can be upgraded throughout the campaign. So, it might be best to begin with the first iteration.

8 Warcraft 3: Reign Of Chaos

Blizzard's Popular Story-Driven RTS That Eases Players Into The Game With Each Campaign

This title not only holds credit for being one of the pioneers of this genre but also the sole reason for the existence of yet another. Launched originally in 2002, Blizzard's Warcraft 3 is the original fantasy RTS. It is also the first to introduce heroes and hero abilities to the genre. Its easy-to-understand nature has made sure that its player base is growing to this day. In fact, a custom map called Defense of the Ancients gained so much of a fan following that Valve took upon the idea years later and created DOTA 2 .

Warcraft 3: Reforged is the modern remake edition of the game, which is being regularly updated and fine-tuned. It is a fine place for any new players to start, be it through the offline campaign or with the robust multiplayer community, though it has been criticized for a variety of reasons.

7 StarCraft 2

A Legendary RTS Set In Space With A Compelling Gameplay Loop

Speaking of multiplayer communities, Blizzard's StarCraft franchise, or more specifically StarCraft 2 , has been dominating the competitive RTS scene for over ten years and shows no signs of stopping.

Highly tense multiplayer matches are the key feature of this title. With a very diverse yet sharp multiplayer experience, StarCraft 2 sits apart from the others on the list. The StarCraft series has also made many RTS games like "Zerg Rush" and "Base Race" famous.

6 Company of Heroes Series

A World War 2 RTS Where Players Will Understand How To Boss The Opposition In No Time

Not all the best RTS for beginners are set in make-believe settings. In fact, Relic Entertainment's Company of Heroes series prides itself on quite the opposite. With both parts of the series set in World War 2, players are given control of both sides of the war depending on the mission as they get in various iconic operations like Operation Barbarossa and the liberation of France.

Bringing a more realistic and gruesome take on RTS games, Company of Heroes is sure to be the game for those who enjoy learning about the history of the Second Great War. The third entry released in 2023 garnered a mixed reception for the most part, although its predecessors are still highly regarded.

5 Halo Wars Series

A Great Beginner-Friendly RTS Set In Rich World Of Halo

Newer players might be afraid of jumping into RTS games because they do not know any IPs. And the solution to that problem is 343 Industries and Creative Assembly's Halo Wars series, especially Halo Wars 2 that comes with improvements over the original game as it focuses on the core features of the RTS genre instead of shiny mechanics.

The title is packed with vehicular action and iconic Elite units and is bound to get players' blood rushing. Moreover, the title's storyline canonically precedes that of Halo: Combat Evolved and continues from its predecessor . This game serves as the portal for any Halo enthusiast to jump into the genre.

4 Command And Conquer

A Combination Of Compelling Lore, Fun Live-Action Cutscenes, And Fun Gameplay Make This Title Great For Beginners

If any RTS franchise could be said to have it all, it is the Command and Conquer franchise. With games set in environments ranging from the setting of the famous IP of Dune 2 to a hyper-futuristic Sci-Fi setting, and with availability from Mobile Phones to the most expensive consoles, this series has not once failed to satisfy RTS fans over the 25 years of entertainment it has provided. And with the recent launch of Command & Conquer: Remastered Collection , entry into the IP could never be easier.

So, regardless of whether one is a fan of vintage games or the latest media, and regardless of whether they play on their mobile phones or their highest-end Desktop, Command and Conquer is the IP for anyone wanting to get into RTS. Oh, and did we mention the live-acted cutscenes instead of the usual rendered kind?

3 Stronghold: Warlords

Players Will Quickly Learn How To Manage Strongholds And Establish Economic Superiority

Not all players aim to defeat their enemies in RTS using aggressive unit micro-ing and hyper-managed troop deployment. Some players wish to out-value opponents with superior resource management and structural advantage. And for such kinds of players, Firefly Studio's Stronghold: Warlords is the game.

The Stronghold series has been famous ever since the first iteration for its gritty approach to war. More often than not, war is not fought by battles but by attrition; the title is lauded for how close it has come to stimulating this reality. The Stronghold series even provides access to such an RTS experience on both PC and mobile.

2 Machines At War 3

A Fun Game With Futuristic Units and Relatively Simple Gameplay

There are multiple franchises with Mobile playable variants available, yet none of these hold a candle to Machines at War 3 as far as mobile accessibility is concerned. This RTS lets the player command a warring kingdom.

This game is easily the best option for primarily mobile phone gamers. The game looks and feels amazing to play, with the random map generator letting players sink a ton of hours into this game without breaking a sweat.

1 Total War: Three Kingdoms

A Great Total War Game Set In China That's Easy To Learn But Hard To Master

Total War: Three Kingdoms is an RTS set in the 3-kingdom period of China. Players can choose a faction out of 12 to push to the top and unify China. The title offers unit-group-based gameplay, meaning that any player can have only specific units on the battlefield at a time. This slower approach to RTS allows newer players to get a hold of the game a bit more easily.

The game features two game modes. One of them is a bit more story-like, while the other focuses on historical authenticity. Players can choose famous generals from history to command and exploit, and each general, in turn, comes with specific units unique to them.

item.title: Spore Website Gets First New Update in 5 Years
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Spore, a 2008 simulation game, has received its first new website update in over 5 years.
  • A new team has taken over Spore, creating an official Discord server for updates, contests, and community interactions.
  • While Maxis and EA continue to develop Spore, the update brings hope for future content and improvements for the player base.

The 2008 simulation game Spore received its first news update in over five years. The team behind Spore has been silent since 2019, but some new updates from the team's community managers could potentially revive the game and its player base.

Spore is an RTS life simulation game developed by Maxis in 2008 and published by EA. As the architects of their own universe, players are able to evolve creatures within a world of their own making. Starting from a single cell and progressing all the way up to space, players have a variety of ways to control how their creatures evolve within the world of Spore. While the game has been widely criticized for its lackluster gameplay, Spore is still loved by many fans and has a relatively active community surrounding it. Despite the radio silence from the team behind Spore since 2019, a new update has started the road to reviving the game's audience.

Available on Spore 's official website, the latest news update was released on Monday, September 30. The update outlined that a new team has taken over Spore and that an official Discord has been created for the community. As of now, two community managers, RogueLyeshal (Rogue) and Reiliyn (Rei) are currently heading up all the community efforts by the team. With Spore being one of the few fun 2000's simulation games that still has an active audience, players may see these community managers making their way around various Spore communities.

Spore Fans Flock to New Official Discord Server

Alongside announcing that a new team is taking over the development of Spore , the game has an official Discord server now. This server will give players a place to read updates from the development team, participate in contests, meet other fans of the game, and discuss all things Spore . Although this news doesn't bring about any changes or new content to the game, it still managed to revive the community with a shimmer of hope for future updates to the game. In the meantime, players can still enjoy creating all sorts of creatures in their own worlds within Spore .

Despite the news of a new team taking over, the life and evolution simulation game Spore will still be developed by Maxis and published by EA. While this update doesn't bring any changes to the game itself, the enthusiasm from the team could bode well for the future of Spore and its players.
